briefTitle: Comparison of Three Different Pain Blocks for Subjects Undergoing VATS (Video Assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery) Procedure.

armGroups.label: Group #1
interventionNames: Drug: US Guided Single Shot Paravertebral Block (0.2% ropivicaine infusion)

armGroups.label: Group #2
interventionNames: Drug: US Guided Paravertebral Catheter (0.2% ropivicaine bolus)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Pt undergoing VATS procedure at Indiana University Hospital
* ASA 1,2,3 or 4
* Age 18 or older, male or female
* Desires Regional anesthesia for postoperative pain control

Exclusion Criteria:

* Any contraindication for Thoracic Epidural or Paravertebral block
* History of substance abuse in the past 6 months
* Patient staying intubated after surgery
* Known allergy or other contraindications to the study medications , which include dilaudid, bupivacaine, ropivacaine

outcomeMeasures.title: The Primary Endpoint of This Study Will be VAS Pain Score at 24 Hours
outcomeMeasures.description: The VAS score will be taken with both rest and movement (knee flexion) and will be measured by a study team investigator using Visual Analog Scale (VAS). Using "units on a scale" of 1-10 for documentation with 10 being the worst pain and 0 being no pain

outcomeMeasures.title: The Primary Endpoint of This Study Will be VAS Pain Score at 48 Hours
outcomeMeasures.description: The VAS scores will be taken with both rest and movement (knee flexion) and will be measured by a study team investigator using Visual Analog Scale (VAS). Using"units on a scale" scale of 1-10 for documentation with 10 being the worst pain and 0 being no pain

outcomeMeasures.title: Secondary Endpoint Includes Total Intravenous Opioid Consumption at 72 Hours
outcomeMeasures.description: Opioid consumption will be collected by a study team member post operatively up to 3 days per protocol time requirements

outcomeMeasures.title: Average Nausea Scores Over 72 Hours
outcomeMeasures.description: Nausea scores will be collected by a study team member post operatively up to 3 days per protocol. Nausea will be recorded as 0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, or 3=severe

outcomeMeasures.title: Average Sedation Scores Over 72 Hours
outcomeMeasures.description: Sedation scores will be documented by a study team member post operatively up to 3 days per protocol requirements. Determining if patient is 0=awake and alert, 1=quietly awake, 2=asleep and arousable, or 3=deep sleep.

outcomeMeasures.title: Subjects Overall Satisfaction Scores
outcomeMeasures.description: Subjects will be followed up at 24 hours post operatively by a study team member to document patient overall satisfaction scores. Score was recorded as 0=dissatisfied, 1=satisfied, 2=very satisfied.

outcomeMeasures.title: Subjects Overall Satisfaction Scores
outcomeMeasures.description: Subjects will be followed up at 48 hours post operatively by a study team member to document patient overall satisfaction scores. Scores will be recorded as 0=dissatisfied, 1=satisfied, 2=very satisfied.
